result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles D. Newkirk

records.addlTxt: SEH for 10/31/22 adjourned to 01/04/23 at 10:30 am on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Confirming email sent to parties. Clerk called and spoke with DE.
Sentencing hearing on January 4, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
At the request of Attorney Carson SEH set for 10/14/22 is rescheduled to 10/31/22 at 3:30 pm; Attorney Carson will be out of the country. Parties notified by email and notice sent to DE.
to Adjourn October 14th hearing

01:40 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant, Charles D. Newkirk, appeared with Attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Hearing was scheduled for 1:15 pm and Attorney Carson appears late at 1:40 pm. Attorney Carson and DE go into the conference room to complete the Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered. Attorney Carson requests a sentencing date in September or October as the DE will be starting treatment/counseling. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Minutes:  10:32am.  Clerk/T. Lema.  Judge Gabriele acting for Branch 3.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Christopher Carson (30min late).  Atty Carson requests a short recess to discuss the case with the ADA.  Court takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes.  Defense counsel reports the case is resolved - requests the JS date be converted a plea hrg date.  No objection by the State.  Time of hrg on 7/18 - changed to 1:15pm.
re: Judicial Rotation
